title: How to Make Theplas

steps.headline: Mix together all of the ingredients except for 1/2 cup (60 g) of flour and the water.
steps.description: Place 1 cup (120 g) of whole wheat flour, ½ cup (67.5 g) of fenugreek leaves, 3 tbsp (45 g) of coriander leaves, 1/4 cup (65 g) of plain yogurt, 1 tsp (6 g) of ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp (2.7 g) of red chili powder, ½ tsp (1 g), of turmeric powder, 1 tsp (2.7 g) of coriander powder, 1 tsp (4.95 ml) of oil, and 1 tsp (5 g) of salt into a large bowl. Use a fork to combine the ingredients.

steps.headline: Knead the mixture and add 3 US tbsp (44 ml) of water.
steps.description: Use your hands to work and knead the dough in the bowl. Add more water if necessary to hold the dough together, but not too much that the dough becomes runny or sticky. When you have finished kneading the dough, it will be soft, moist enough to not crumble, and dry enough so that it's not sticky. 3 US tbsp (44 ml) of water is an approximate amount. Use as much or as little water as your dough requires.

steps.headline: Grease the dough with 1 tsp (14.8 ml) of oil.
steps.description: Use a spoon to coat the outside of the dough with the oil. Lift the dough up from the bowl to make sure that all of the sides are greased.

steps.headline: Cover the dough and let it sit for 20 minutes.
steps.description: Use either a plate or a muslin cloth to cover the opening of the bowl. Leave the bowl out on your work surface for 15-20 minutes.

steps.headline: Divide the dough into 7 parts of the same size.
steps.description: Remove the covering on the dough. Use your hands to break the dough into 7 parts. Roll the dough in your palm to make a round, ball shape.

steps.headline: Flatten each ball of dough into a patty and coat it with whole wheat flour.
steps.description: Press each ball of dough against a rolling board with your palm. Use the remaining ½ cup (60 g) of flour to dust each part of the dough thoroughly. Use a wooden rolling board.

steps.headline: Use a rolling pin to spread each circle of dough out.
steps.description: Place each patty of dough on the rolling board and roll it out to 6–7 in (15–18 cm) in diameter. Roll out each patty of dough individually before moving onto the next one. When you roll out the dough, aim for it to be relatively thin. However, make sure that the dough isn't rolled so thin that it will tear or break when it's moved.

steps.headline: Heat the tawa for 2-3 minutes over a medium heat and then add the dough.
steps.description: Place 1 flattened piece of dough in the center of the tawa. If you don't have a tawa pan, use a griddle pan instead. Cook each flattened piece of dough individually on the tawa. However, if you have more than 1 tawa pan, you will be able to work through the batch of dough faster. A tawa pan is a popular cooking pan in Asia. It is a flat, disc-shaped pan that is made out of aluminum, sheet or cast iron.

steps.headline: Flip the dough after 2-3 minutes and spread oil over the other side.
steps.description: It will take only a few minutes for tiny bubbles to appear on the surface of the dough. Once you have flipped the dough, spread ½ tsp (2.5 ml) of oil over the top of the dough. Use a spatula to flip the dough.

steps.headline: Flip the dough again after 30 seconds and coat it with oil.
steps.description: Spread ½ tsp (2.5 ml) of oil roughly out over the other side of the dough. Use a spatula to press the dough against the pan as it cooks to help it cook evenly. Cook this side of the dough for a further 30 seconds. You can either spread the oil out using the spatula or just drizzle it over the dough.

steps.headline: Continue this process for 5 minutes until golden brown patches appear.
steps.description: Repeat the process of flipping the dough and cooking it for 30 seconds as many times as necessary, until you start to see irregularly shaped, light brown patches appear on the dough. Remove the thepla from the heat once it has cooked, and then begin cooking the next rounded circle of dough. You don’t need to continue applying oil for the rest of the flipping process. You only needed to apply 1 coat of oil to each side at the beginning.

steps.headline: Serve the theplas immediately with curd or masala tea.
steps.description: Stack the theplas on a plate to serve them. Enjoy the theplas straight away while they are still hot from the pan. If you don’t plan to eat the theplas straight away, don’t stack them until they are cool as the moisture could make them go soggy. Theplas are often also enjoyed with sweet pickles or chutney.
